alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 2:33PM PST until March 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with up to 17 inches above 4500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Period of heaviest snow is expected to continue through Thursday evening. After a lull in snowfall rates before sunrise Friday, another round heavy snow is expected Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
